TopicTitle: The Dunatian, Playable Save File (Like a Scenario)

Articles.Content:
Woohoo! were riding a big fire cracker into the sky boys

http://i.imgur.com/d3PCvvW.png

New Ares 1 Rocket

Crew 8

Stages 3

almost 400t

parts about 150 or so

Download

If you want something that looks accurate but does not fly as well Download

Hey man, I will have a look at it today and see what I can do. Had a very rough night last night so it will be a bit later in the day..

That looks really awesome! Are there any plans for the delta IX launching Iris?

- - - Updated - - -

Just downloaded, and there are a few problems. When rolling to point east-west, the ares pushes over to the right, an I cannot get it pointed straight. Second, when staging for the second stage, it's set to release the fairing covering the fuel, and I don't think it is meant to. And third, upon circularizing, it nearly shakes itself apart.

Not unless it is in the book.

I did notice some of these problems, was just glad to get it into orbit for the first time really. If you fix anything let me know so I can include you in the list, thanks for testing!

I let it rise naturally on the SRB"s and then pushed it gently over at the end.

The second stage is a bit wobbly right now.

When I hit staged the second stage it was already around 30km up so the fairing was just deadweight by then.
It is in the book, if you haven't read it I won't spoil it for you. I can give you my updates, if you want

It is in the book, if you haven't read it I won't spoil it for you. I can give you my updates, if you want

I have read the book several times, I don't remember it specifically, and I am not sure it is necessary as part of the game play. I am reading it again to fill in details so I will see. Wikipedia says it was launched on a Pegasus XL. I would be ecstatic if you fixed issues and uploaded the craft file.
I just read it a couple of days ago, and it launched on a delta IX rocket, from what I remember. I will fix it up, and give you the file in a few hours.

I just read it a couple of days ago, and it launched on a delta IX rocket, from what I remember. I will fix it up, and give you the file in a few hours.

I have been doing some work on it as well, you may want to test this version, it's 2 stages (like the original) it's much lighter and flies much better. 75 parts, 166t the SRB's will push your apoapsis to 100km and then a skipper (closer to the J-2X than the poodle and and not as overpowered as the Rhino) to circularise. It's close to the 2/3rd scale as well (it's 10m short, from the silhouette it's the upper stage that is short). Might need an empty tank to extend it a bit.

Download

Edited August 17, 2015 by selfish_meme
Are you sure that you want this to be near real- scale and the rest ksp scale?

Are you sure that you want this to be near real- scale and the rest ksp scale?

I am not going for a scale replica, more of an functional/aesthetic one, if they happen to coincide then that's good but not necessary, the only reason I mentioned it was it happened to be close and the second stage was looking short. Functional first, aesthetic second and scale last.
Hey I could help with the orange tank ares 1 when I get back from vacation. Posting this from Manchester Airport BTW.

Where you off to mate?
Britain, actually first time.

Britain, actually first time.

That's awesome man. So Manchester then north? Scotland?
Yup, just saw Hadrian's Wall, and anyways I apologize for the temporary thread derail.

Yup, just saw Hadrian's Wall, and anyways I apologize for the temporary thread derail.

What about Stonehenge? I've always wanted to see it, but a few complications have arisen by the fact that I live on a different continent than it.
Inverness was really nice, lots of scotch distilleries, my castle is there, Cawdor Castle, long story
I have an alt. Ares I in the works, pics soon

OK Ares 1 work is at a good spot, I did some work on a Duna Descent Vehicle as well. Seats 6 (tick) is a tin can (tick) has multiple chutes (tick) has thrusters to control descent (tick) has enough TWR for a short hop (tick). From the book I imagined something rough and ungainly. This is what I came up with.

I think I am in love with fairings, they are so useful for crafting ships.
Okay, I can do the Ares V and mk.3 cargo unit

Hey I can provide my Ares V when I get home.

Also, for anyone making the MAV, it actually has three stages, the ISRU and landing stage, and two ascent stages.

Posting this from Edinburgh Castle.

for anyone making the MAV, it actually has three stages, the ISRU and landing stage, and two ascent stages.
